hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >3% price spike within 2 hours following major negative news headlines (budget crisis, regulatory threats), but aggregate exchange liquidity (sum of top 5 exchanges' BTC/USD order book depth at ±2%) decreases by >15% during the same period, the price will revert >60% of the initial spike within the next 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Negative news spikes driven by panic selling into thin liquidity create artificial price movements. When liquidity providers withdraw during volatility, the spike is unsustainable. The retracement occurs as opportunistic buyers step in at perceived discounts once the initial panic subsides.
entry_conditions: Aggregate BTC/USD liquidity depth (±2%) decreases >15% from pre-spike 4-hour average
Volume spike > 2x 24-hour average but with declining participation (number of unique addresses in transactions)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds initial spike high by 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >50% of such events see price continue trending in spike direction beyond 6 hours with sustained or increasing liquidity.
